com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.utils

Class ModuleUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.utils.ModuleUtils

  • public class ModuleUtils
extends Object
    Utility functions for loading modules into the system. Typically is used by calling loadModulesFromConfig(Config) this will create all the service injectors needed. Services can then be retrieved from getService(Class, Optional) or using any of the other Contexts that implement IServiceContext.
    Author:
    Burch

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ModuleUtils.CachingProvider<I>
      Caching wrapper for Provider
      protected static class  ModuleUtils.Loggable
      Loads the normal (non SL4J logger) into the classpath before LOG4J-OVER-SL4J or SL4J-LOG4J12 have a change to load logging to work
      static class  ModuleUtils.ServiceBinderModule
      Module that the config loader uses to bind the configured interfaces to the given services.
      static class  ModuleUtils.ServiceContext
      Implementation of the IServiceContext class for easy usage from the other contexts.
      static class  ModuleUtils.ServiceModule
      Default IServiceContext binding module.

      static void disableTestInjection()
      For tests not using Guice, this has to be called (or any modules that use the ModuleUtils.getAppInjector.thenRun() constructs will hang)
      static CompletableFuture<com.google.inject.Injector> getAppInjector()
      Returns a future to an app injector that is only valid after the app injector has been created *and* the app has been initialized (via at least one call to app initialization)

      Returns the global configuration bean associated with the last configuration generated

      Returns the static config set up by a call to loadModulesFromConfig or createInjector INTENDED TO BE CALLED FROM guice_submodule.configure() (or later of course, though you should be using injected beans by then)

    • Method Detail

      • getStaticConfig

        public static com.typesafe.config.Config getStaticConfig()
        Returns the static config set up by a call to loadModulesFromConfig or createInjector INTENDED TO BE CALLED FROM guice_submodule.configure() (or later of course, though you should be using injected beans by then)
        Returns:
        the user config (or whatever is on the classpath as a fallback)

      • getGlobalProperties

        public static GlobalPropertiesBean getGlobalProperties()
        Returns the global configuration bean associated with the last configuration generated
        Returns:

      • loadModulesFromConfig

        protected static void loadModulesFromConfig(com.typesafe.config.Config config)
                                     throws Exception
        Loads up all the services it can find in the given config file. Typically the config comes from ConfigFactory.load() which just loads the default environment config files and env vars. To override the config location call this function before requesting a getService.
        Parameters:
        config -
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getService

        public static <I> I getService(Class<I> serviceClazz,
                               Optional<String> serviceName)
        Returns back an instance of the requested serviceClazz/annotation if an injector exists for it. If the injectors have not yet been created will try to load them from the default config.
        Parameters:
        serviceClazz -
        serviceName -
        Returns:

      • getServiceProvider

        public static <I> com.google.inject.Provider<I> getServiceProvider(Class<I> serviceClazz,
                                                                   Optional<String> serviceName)
        FOR CIRCULAR DEPENDENCY CASES Returns back an instance of the requested serviceClazz/annotation if an injector exists for it. If the injectors have not yet been created will try to load them from the default config.
        Parameters:
        serviceClazz -
        serviceName -
        Returns:

      • createTestInjector

        public static com.google.inject.Injector createTestInjector(List<com.google.inject.Module> modules,
                                                            Optional<com.typesafe.config.Config> config)
                                                     throws Exception
        THIS VERSION IS FOR TESTS - CAN BE RUN MULTIPLE TIMES Creates a child injector from our parent configured injector to allow applications to take advantage of our injection without having to create a config file. The typical reason to do this is to inject the IServiceContext into your application so you can access the other configured services via com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interface.data_access.IServiceContext#getService()
        Parameters:
        modules - Any modules you wanted added to your child injector (put your bindings in these)
        config - If exists will reset injectors to create defaults via the config
        Returns:
        Throws:
        Exception

      • disableTestInjection

        public static void disableTestInjection()
        For tests not using Guice, this has to be called (or any modules that use the ModuleUtils.getAppInjector.thenRun() constructs will hang)

      • initializeApplication

        public static <T> T initializeApplication(List<com.google.inject.Module> modules,
                                          Optional<com.typesafe.config.Config> config,
                                          fj.data.Either<Class<T>,T> application)
                                   throws Exception
        APP LEVEL VERSION - ONLY CREATES STUFF ONCE. CANNOT NORMALLY BE CALLED FROM JUNIT TESTS - USE createTestInjector for that Creates a single application level injector and either injects members into application, or If called multiple times, will wait for the first time to complete before performing the desired action. To get the created injector, use getAppInjector
        Parameters:
        modules - Any modules you wanted added to your child injector (put your bindings in these)
        config - If exists will reset injectors to create defaults via the config
        application - - either a class to create, or an object to inject
        Returns:
        Throws:
        Exception

      • initializeApplication

        public static <T> T initializeApplication(List<com.google.inject.Module> modules,
                                          Optional<com.typesafe.config.Config> config,
                                          fj.data.Either<Class<T>,T> application,
                                          Optional<Function<List<com.google.inject.Module>,com.google.inject.Injector>> injector_builder_lambda)
                                   throws Exception
        APP LEVEL VERSION - ONLY CREATES STUFF ONCE. CANNOT NORMALLY BE CALLED FROM JUNIT TESTS - USE createTestInjector for that Creates a single application level injector and either injects members into application, or If called multiple times, will wait for the first time to complete before performing the desired action. To get the created injector, use getAppInjector
        Parameters:
        modules - Any modules you wanted added to your child injector (put your bindings in these)
        config - If exists will reset injectors to create defaults via the config
        application - - either a class to create, or an object to inject
